email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry - Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I hope this email finds you well. I’m reaching out regarding your inquiry for a crude oil shipment from Houston to Rotterdam. We have a suitable vessel, the MV Ocean Star, with a DWT of 150,000 and an LOA of 280m. The laycan is 15-20 October. I can offer a starting freight rate of $52.50 per metric ton. Let me know your thoughts. Best regards, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry - Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the quick response. The vessel details look good, but the freight rate is a bit higher than expected. Given the current market, could you consider something in the low $50s? Also, could you confirm the laytime and demurrage terms? Best, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry - Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, thanks for your feedback. I understand your concerns. After discussing with the owner, we can offer a revised rate of $51.25 per metric ton. Laytime is 72 hours total, and demurrage is set at $25,000 per day pro rata. Let me know if this works for you. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry - Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the revised offer. The rate is more acceptable, but could we push the laycan to 18-23 October? Also, can we cap the demurrage at $20,000 per day? Looking forward to your confirmation. Best, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry - Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I’ve confirmed with the owner. We can adjust the laycan to 18-23 October, and the demurrage can be capped at $20,000 per day. The final freight rate remains at $51.25 per metric ton. If this works for you, I’ll draft the charter party agreement. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry - Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, that sounds good. Please proceed with drafting the charter party agreement. Let’s aim to finalize by end of day. Thanks for your flexibility. Best, John
